results.title: Framing
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Looks at the notion of the television camera putting a frame around the world. Discusses on-screen and off-screen space, real and apparent size, and the frame within the frame. Devised and narrated by Peter Thompson.

results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions and Chris O'Rourke

results.title: Frames of reference
results.creator_credit: Educational Services Incorporated Film Division, Kevin Smith, Stephen White and Richard Leacock
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Demonstrates the changes in observed motion of a freely falling body viewed from differently moving frames of reference. Donald Ivey and Patterson Hume discuss relative motion, accelerated and inertial frames of reference, and show the inadequacy of Newtonian physics, calling for calculation of fictitious forces to describe relative motions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Educational Services Incorporated Film Division, Kevin Smith, Stephen White and Richard Leacock
